dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Streaming turned profits in 2024. Wall Street's biggest worry is whether momentum can last.
News Content: For years, the world's biggest media companies struggled to make money off of their streaming services. The culprits: pricey content, user churn, and lots of competition.

In 2024, that finally changed.

The five giants — Netflix (NFLX), Disney (DIS), Paramount (PARA), NBCUniversal's Peacock (CMCSA), and Warner Bros. Discovery's Max (WBD) — collectively reported a profit in the first nine months of the year for the very first time. In total, those five companies delivered earnings of roughly $5.9 billion, significantly ahead of the $142 million loss the group reported in the year-ago period.

Netflix led the charge, pulling in roughly $6.9 billion in earnings in the first three quarters. (Wall Street declared the company the unofficial winner of the streaming wars.) But there's more: Earlier this week the company reported an additional $1.87 billion in profits to end the fourth quarter — and nearly 20 million more subscribers.

The other four media giants will report fourth quarter results later this month and next, with Comcast first up on Jan. 30. A big question for investors is whether or not traditional players can successfully follow the leader.

Last year delivered some early answers. Disney and Paramount Global each reported their first quarter of streaming profits in August. Also, Peacock significantly narrowed year-over-year losses, while WBD's streaming profits ended the year on positive footing.

Macquarie analyst Tim Nollen categorized the improvements as "progress," but cautioned that even the streamers who have hit profitability don't have enough profits to generate significant margins. Most, with the obvious exception of Netflix, have hit just around breakeven.

For Morningstar analyst Matthew Dolgin, the key to success is "the pace of revenue growth." He added, "To me, profits are a lot about scale. ... So if you can increase scale, which we saw some benefits from this past year, then you can maintain profitability."

For traditional media companies, he continued, being profitable isn't enough. "Because they have terrible linear businesses that continue to decline, they need streaming to be more than just profitable. They need streaming to produce fast-growing profits."

What lies ahead

The "streaming wars," which unofficially kicked off in November 2019 following the launch of Disney's flagship streaming platform, set off an accelerated race for content, talent, and subscribers. That led to an era of overspending as platforms, both new and established, raced to lure top producers and secure the most sought-after shows.

Story Continues

But investors quickly realized that it's difficult to monetize users, justify the high cost of content, keep subscribers engaged, and turn a profit. One of the biggest reasons: streaming's low price point. With the exception of cable replacement services like YouTube TV and Hulu + Live TV, prices can range anywhere from $4.99 a month to $22.99.

That low cost means more subscribers are needed to generate significant returns. Lourdes Balduque via Getty Images

In response to investors' growing profit fears, companies adjusted their strategies and were eventually able to attract more subscribers through controversial password-sharing crackdowns and multi-tier subscription offerings, in addition to more strategic content acquisitions and the return of key original programming.

Companies also shifted how aggressively they spend their money. Instead of ballooning content budgets and releasing as many shows as possible, streamers pulled back to focus on more quality over quantity projects.

"Everything was kind of messy for a few years," Macquarie's Nollen said. "Streamers are finally getting the revenue and cost lines to balance out. But it's questionable how profitable these services can be."

(edited)

One obstacle to achieving consistent profits is combating increased churn in the face of higher prices. (Netflix became the latest platform to boost subscription costs in the US, bumping the prices of its various tiers earlier this week.)

"The bigger risk is really retaining the customer base and figuring out whether we get to a threshold where there are too many platforms," Morningstar's Dolgin said. Also, "there's a limit" to how much more streamers can raise prices. Simultaneously, there's a limit to how many more subscribers streamers can add.

"Somewhere, you need to get that right in order to keep profits growing at a good pace," he said.

To combat fickle subscribers, competing platforms are now bundling their services together. As WBD CEO David Zaslav told investors last year, "There's more strength together."

"I have a difficult time envisioning a scenario where any one of these players takes Netflix's mantle," Dolgin said. "So [bundling with one another] is how they close the gap. They don't do it individually. They could potentially do it as a collective."

And if recent news of mass layoffs and restructurings are any indication (Case in point: CNN's digital revamp), the road to catching up to Netflix — and just basic survival in the streaming-first era — might be a bumpy one.

•USD

(NFLX)

Alexandra Canal is a Senior Reporter at Yahoo Finance. Follow her on X @allie_canal, LinkedIn, and email her at alexandra.canal@yahoofinance.com.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's significant dividend income from various stocks, including Apple. While Buffett's reduced stake in Apple may suggest a lack of confidence, the overall context of strong dividend income and the potential for Apple to increase its dividend could positively influence investor sentiment. However, the mention of Buffett's decreasing position may also raise concerns among investors. Therefore, the probabilities reflect a balanced view of potential positive and negative impacts on Apple's stock price.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline and content primarily discuss the evolution of mega-cap stock groupings and Apple's continued presence in these groups (FAANG, Magnificent Seven, BATMMAAN). While the article doesn't directly address Apple's financial performance or specific product announcements, its inclusion in the 'BATMMAAN' group suggests continued market relevance and strength. This positive association, although indirect, could slightly boost investor confidence. However, the article also focuses on broader market trends and comparisons between different groups, which dilutes the direct impact on Apple's stock. Therefore, the impact is likely to be slightly positive, but not significantly so. The related videos don't seem to have any direct impact on Apple's stock price.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news mentions Apple's upcoming earnings report, where AI will be a key focus.  Strong AI-related announcements could boost the stock price, while disappointing results could lead to a decline. The Federal Reserve's interest rate decision is also a significant factor. A rate hike could negatively impact the overall market and Apple's stock price, while a pause or smaller increase might be viewed more favorably.  The overall impact is uncertain, with both positive and negative factors at play.  Therefore, the probabilities are assigned reflecting this uncertainty, leaning slightly towards a price rise given Apple's generally strong performance and the potential for positive AI news.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights several key points about Apple Inc. (AAPL): 1) The stock has underperformed recently, losing about 15% of its value since its 52-week high due to concerns about China and its AI strategy. 2) Bearish analysts are projecting a guidance cut, and EPS estimates for fiscal year 2025 have been declining. 3) However, Apple bulls believe the negative sentiment is overdone and expect the company to announce a local AI partner soon, which could mitigate some concerns. 4) Apple's margins are expected to be modestly up year-over-year, which is a positive sign. Given the mixed signals—negative sentiment and declining estimates vs. potential positive developments in AI and stable margins—the stock price movement is uncertain but leans slightly negative in the short term due to the prevailing bearish sentiment.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's potential as a bear market stock, highlighting its robust financial health, consistent record of returning value to shareholders, and the introduction of new features such as health-monitoring tools. Despite concerns about a potential bear market in 2025 from various economists, Apple's strong fundamentals and diversified product ecosystem position it well. However, the overall cautious sentiment and predictions of a possible downturn could temper investor enthusiasm. The article's positive tone on Apple's resilience and growth potential suggests a higher likelihood of the stock price rising, but the external economic concerns introduce uncertainty.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses the profitability of streaming services, particularly Netflix, and the challenges faced by traditional media companies in achieving consistent profits. While the article highlights the progress made by these companies, it also notes the concerns about retaining customer base, combating increased churn, and the limitations of raising prices. Given that Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned in the article as a major player in the streaming wars, the impact of this news on AAPL's stock price is likely to be minimal. However, as a major player in the technology and entertainment industry, any positive developments in the streaming sector could have a slight positive effect on AAPL's stock price.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news highlights mixed signals regarding the economic environment and market sentiment. On one hand, there's cautious optimism about the economy and strong consumer spending, which supports the stock price. On the other hand, there are concerns about inflation, interest rates, and potential market peaks indicated by foreign investment trends. Apple Inc. (AAPL) is highlighted as a resilient stock with robust financial health and growing demand for its products. However, it is also noted that some analysts believe in higher returns from other stocks. Given the balanced outlook provided by the news, the probability of stock price movement remains relatively moderate.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's significant dividend income from various stocks, including Apple. While Buffett's reduced stake in Apple may suggest a lack of confidence, the overall context of strong dividend income and the potential for Apple to increase its dividend could positively influence investor sentiment. However, concerns about Apple's recent performance and external economic factors introduce uncertainty. Given the mixed signals, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising, reflecting the positive aspects of dividend income and Apple's strong fundamentals, but tempered by the caution surrounding Buffett's reduced stake.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news focuses on the evolution of mega-cap stock acronyms, with Apple consistently being a part of these groups (FAANG, Magnificent Seven, BATMMAAN). This suggests Apple's continued market relevance and strength. While the article doesn't delve into Apple's specific financials, its inclusion in the 'BATMMAAN' group implies a positive sentiment. Considering the previous rounds, there's a slight positive bias in most predictions, although some models have leaned towards a negative outlook due to concerns about AI strategy and market conditions. Given Apple's consistent presence in these elite groups and the general positive sentiment, I'll slightly increase the probability of a price rise compared to the previous rounds' average.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news piece focuses on upcoming Big Tech earnings, including Apple's, and the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision.  While the news is broadly market-focused, Apple's inclusion in the earnings announcements is significant.  The previous predictions are mixed, with some leaning slightly positive and others slightly negative.  The uncertainty surrounding the Fed's decision and the potential impact on the overall market adds to the volatility.  The AI focus in the earnings reports presents both opportunity and risk; strong AI-related announcements could boost the stock, while disappointing results could hurt it. Considering the mixed signals and the overall market uncertainty, I'm assigning probabilities that reflect a relatively balanced outlook, slightly favoring a price rise due to Apple's generally strong performance and the potential for positive AI news, but acknowledging the significant downside risk from the Fed's decision and the overall market sentiment.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple Inc. (AAPL) in the context of upcoming Q4 earnings, highlighting several key factors: 1) AAPL shares have recently underperformed, losing about 15% of their value due to worries about China and its AI strategy. 2) Bearish analysts are projecting a potential guidance cut, with declining EPS estimates for fiscal year 2025. 3) Apple's net margins are expected to be modestly up year-over-year, which is a positive sign. 4) There is bullish sentiment from some investors who believe the negative outlook is overdone and expect positive AI developments. Given these mixed signals—negative sentiment and declining estimates vs. potential positive AI announcements and stable margins—the stock price movement is uncertain but leans slightly negative in the near term due to the prevailing bearish sentiment and market concerns.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's potential as a bear market stock, highlighting its robust financial health, consistent record of returning value to shareholders, and the introduction of new features such as health-monitoring tools. Despite concerns about a potential bear market in 2025 from various economists, Apple's strong fundamentals and diversified product ecosystem position it well. However, the overall cautious sentiment and predictions of a possible downturn could temper investor enthusiasm. The article's positive tone on Apple's resilience and growth potential suggests a higher likelihood of the stock price rising, but the external economic concerns introduce uncertainty.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news article discusses the profitability of streaming services, particularly Netflix, and the challenges faced by traditional media companies in achieving consistent profits. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned in the article as a major player in the streaming wars, the company's involvement in the streaming industry through its Apple TV+ service could be indirectly affected by the trends and challenges discussed. The article highlights the progress made by streaming companies in achieving profitability, but also notes concerns about retaining customer base, combating increased churn, and the limitations of raising prices. Given that Apple is a major player in the technology and entertainment industry, any positive developments in the streaming sector could have a slight positive effect on AAPL's stock price. However, the lack of direct mention and the mixed outlook for the streaming industry suggest that the impact on AAPL's stock price will be minimal. Considering the previous predictions from other models, which show a range of opinions on the stock's movement, the estimated probabilities reflect a balanced view, leaning slightly towards a neutral stance due to the indirect relevance of the news to Apple's stock.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The financial news covers multiple aspects affecting Apple Inc., including economic forecasts, market sentiments, and the company's own financial health and product offerings. The news indicates a cautious optimism with mixed signals about potential economic downturns, but also highlights Apple's robust financial health, consistent shareholder value return, and recent product innovations like health-monitoring tools. Previous predictions show a balance between positive and negative factors, leaning towards a slight positive sentiment but also acknowledging uncertainties and competing investments. Given the current context, the stock price movement probabilities seem moderately balanced.
